title: Grow Your Own Grains Part 1: Best Seeding Methods -- Low Tech Video No. 24

tasks.task: Planting oats, barley, and field peas in a tilled field using manual seeds and a garden seeder.
subtasks: Clearing weeds from the previous fallow field using a disk tilling method.
Preparing the soil by tilling with a tiller and applying horse manure compost.
Broadcasting seeds (using by-hand techniques) for oats, barley, and field peas.
Adjusting the garden seeder to achieve the desired planting density for each crop.
Modifying the seeding discs to control the number of seeds per pass to achieve the specific seeding rate.
Marking row positions with poles to guide the planting of each seed row with precise spacing.
Planting rows with a single-row seeder in eight-inch intervals, ensuring proper depth coverage.
Managing moisture and weed competition by maintaining the planted rows and controlling surrounding weeds manually.
Demonstrating the process of no-till farming versus tilling, explaining the benefits and challenges of each method in weed management.
Discussing the appropriate timing for planting each grain crop based on frost sensitivity and regional considerations.
